channel.title: Problems while installing Ubuntu
channel.description:
While installing Ubuntu today I got an error, this was during the second installation I attempted as the first one didn't work at all. I couldn't even open up linux, although probably due to a fault on my end as I'm a noob to linux in general.
This is the error I got whilst installing it:
[IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/2zdninn.jpg[/img]
and also this is the constant error I get throughout the installation:
[IMG]http://i54.tinypic.com/fn4gn5.jpg[/img]
Does anybody know what I'm doing wrong, or what can be done to fix it, if anything?

item.title: Problems while installing Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:

post on the ubuntu forums

Read full topic

item.title: Problems while installing Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

I’m pretty sure I ran into a similar problem once while installing Linux. Wubi needs access to the Internet to download the ISO. A firewall was blocking the program with me, maybe try turning your firewall of or creating an exception?

You might also want to check the log? If all fails you could try downloading the ISO? As for the constant error message, I really have no idea.

Though I did some Google research and most people tend to find there system is infected causing such errors. Or that they need to install a windows update though your fix could be completely irrelevant. Everyone seems to have different problems with it.

May help:

http://www.consumingexperience.com/2007/11/windows-no-disk-exception-processing.html

Read full topic
